meanings.definition: Relating to the chemical composition of the earth's crust.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a geochemical analysis of the soil samples.
meanings.sent2: The geochemical properties of the rocks indicated high levels of iron.
meanings.sent3: The geochemical puzzle was finally solved by the team of researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a complex, geochemical map of thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The geochemical nature of the landscape was evident in the colorful mineral deposits.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of the distribution and movement of chemical elements within the earth.
meanings.sent1: The geochemical survey revealed the presence of rare minerals in the region.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use geochemical techniques to trace the origin of volcanic eruptions.
meanings.sent3: The geochemical investigation turned into a thrilling adventure for the team.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed through the conversation like geochemical elements in the earth's layers.
meanings.sent5: The geochemical analysis provided valuable insights into the earth's natural processes.
